summary: Roger Wolcott Sperry  was an American neurobiologist and Nobel Prize winner.
full_text: Roger Wolcott Sperry  was a neuropsychologist, neurobiologist and Nobel laureate who, together with David Hunter Hubel and Torsten Nils Wiesel, won the 1981 Nobel Prize in Physiology and Medicine for his work with split-brain research. A Review of General Psychology survey, published in 2002, ranked Sperry as the 44th most cited psychologist of the 20th century.
title: Roger Wolcott Sperry
